preheader: GenAi portfolio slips as tech and cyclicals face broad selloff
opening_paragraph: The GenAi Chosen portfolio fell -5.82% this week, bringing total returns since inception to -3.01%. The S&P 500 also declined, dropping -1.41% for the week, while Bitcoin tumbled -12.10% amid fading risk appetite. Heavy selling across growth and cyclical stocks pushed the portfolio below its initial value for the first time.

key_insights.title: Tech Leads Decline
key_insights.description: High-beta tech names such as Western Digital (-10.77%), Seagate (-8.40%), and Palantir (-9.52%) drove the portfolio's pullback as investors rotated out of AI and data infrastructure stocks.

key_insights.title: Gold Fails to Defend
key_insights.description: Newmont Corp fell -8.59%, showing that gold miners offered little protection during the week’s risk-off move despite their typical defensive profile.

key_insights.title: Cyclicals Lose Momentum
key_insights.description: Royal Caribbean (-4.79%) and NRG Energy (-3.36%) weakened as travel and energy stocks were unable to resist broader market turbulence.

market_context: Market sentiment turned decisively risk-off, with growth, tech, and cyclical sectors facing broad selling pressure. The blog highlights fading risk appetite as the main driver of declines across equities and Bitcoin. Over the next 1-3 weeks, continued macro uncertainty may keep pressure on high-beta stocks, while the portfolio’s momentum-driven strategy may shift if defensive factors begin showing stronger signals.

benchmark_comparison.summary: The GenAi portfolio underperformed the S&P 500 but held up better than Bitcoin during a broadly risk-off week. All benchmarks ended the period in negative territory.
